com.symbol.emdk.sam

Class SAM

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.symbol.emdk.sam.SAM

  • public class SAM
extends java.lang.Object
    SAM class will represent and provides access to the physical SAMs 

     
 	Example Usage:
  List<SAM> connectedSAMList = samManager.enumerateSAMs();
  SAM sam = connectedSAMList.get(0);
  SAMType samType = sam.getSamType();
  SAMType SAMStatus = sam.getSamStatus();
  sam.connect();
  sam.transceive(byte[],short,boolean);
  sam.disconnect();

      This method will return the current SAM status whether the SAM is connected or not.

      Sets the SmartCard PPS (Protocol and Parameters Selection).

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        public void connect()
             throws SAMException
        Connects to the SAM. If an another application is connected to the same SAM, this will a SAMException. You may use isConnected() to determine if you have already connected to the SAM. You must call disconnect() when you are done using the SAM, otherwise it will remain locked and be unavailable to other applications. 

         
 Example Usage:
 sam.connect();
        Throws:
        SAMException - The exception will thrown if the connection to the SAM fails.

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        Disconnects from SAM. This method releases the SAM hardware resources for other application to use. You must call this as soon as you're done using the SAM 

         
 Example Usage:
 sam.disconnect();

      • transceive

        public byte[] transceive(byte[] apdu,
                         short responseLength,
                         boolean userFormattedProtocolFrame)
                  throws SAMException
        The method will be used to send the APDUs to the SAM. Exception will be thrown in an error. 

         
 Example Usage:
 sam.transceive(byte[],short,boolean);
        Parameters:
        apdu - Command APDU
        responseLength - Length of expected response. Pass this parameter as 0, when expected response length is unknown while calling this API.
        userFormattedProtocolFrame - This parameter applicable for only T1 protocol. Typically user will provide this parameter as false. true: User provides frame header, Command APDU (C-APDU) and trailer. false: User provides only Command APDU (C-APDU). Typically user will provide this parameter as false.
        Returns:
        byte[]
        Throws:
        SAMException - Exception will be thrown if any error occurs while executing transceive call

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        This method will return the current SAM status whether the SAM is connected or not.
        Returns:
        boolean

      • getSamType

        public SAMType getSamType()
        This method will return the type of the SAM (i.e MIFARE, CALYPSO, FELICA)
        Returns:
        SAMType

      • getSamIndex

        public int getSamIndex()
        This method will return the slot index of the SAM. The indexes starting from 1.
        Returns:
        int

      • getSmartCardATR

        public byte[] getSmartCardATR()
                       throws SAMException
        Gets the SmartCard ATR. Exception will be thrown in an error. 

         
 Example Usage:
 sam.getSmartCardATR();
        Returns:
        byte[] Returns a byte[] of 33 bytes on success.
        Throws:
        SAMException - Exception will be thrown if any error occurs while executing the API call.

      • setSmartCardPPS

        public int setSmartCardPPS(byte fd,
                           byte protocol)
                    throws SAMException
        Sets the SmartCard PPS (Protocol and Parameters Selection). Exception will be thrown in an unknown error. 

         
 Example Usage:
 int result = sam.setSmartCardPPS(byte);
 if(result==0){
     //Success
 }else{
     //failure
 }
        Parameters:
        fd - fd - Dividers for calculating the correct SAM clock. fd= Fi/Di ratio
        Returns:
        int int Returns 0 for success and non-zero for failure.
        Throws:
        SAMException
